q: Energy is the __________ property that must be transferred to an object in order to perform work on, or to heat the object.
Energy is the capacity to do __________.
Energy is a __________ quantity.
The SI unit for energy is __________.
The Law of Conservation of energy states that energy can be __________ in form, but not created or destroyed.
__________ energy is one of the kinds of energy mentioned in the document.
__________ energy is another kind of energy mentioned in the document.
__________ potential energy is a specific type of potential energy mentioned.
__________ energy is a form of energy stored in chemical bonds.
__________ energy is a form of energy related to electric and magnetic fields.
In plants, energy transfer takes place through the process of __________.
In photosynthesis, __________ energy is converted to chemical energy.
The chemical energy in plants is stored in the form of __________ or organic matter.
Energy resources can be classified as __________ or non-renewables.
__________, natural gas, and coal are examples of fossil fuels.
__________ gas liquids are another type of non-renewable energy resource.
__________ energy is a non-renewable energy source that doesn't involve fossil fuels.
__________ energy, geothermal energy, and wind energy are examples of renewable energy sources.
__________ and hydropower are two other examples of renewable energy sources.
Nonrenewable energy began replacing most renewable energy in the early __________.
By the early-1900s, __________ fuels were the main source of energy.
Fossil fuels are mixtures of __________ that formed from the remains of animals and plants that lived millions of years ago.
__________ are microscopic organisms whose remains contributed to the formation of fossil fuels.
Hydrocarbon gas liquids are categorized chemically as __________ and alkenes.
HGLs can be used as feedstock in __________ plants to make chemicals, plastics, and synthetic rubber.
Nuclear energy is released during nuclear __________ or fusion.
__________ energy is radiant light and heat from the sun that is harnessed using a range of ever-evolving technologies.
__________ energy is heat derived within the sub-surface of the earth.
Wind energy is created using a __________, a device that channels the power of the wind to generate electricity.
__________ or Biofuels are a renewable energy source made from organic matter or wastes.
__________ or hydroelectricity refers to the conversion of energy from flowing water into electricity.
